Title: VIJAY's House Warming Celebration

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: Annoying day by Abigail

Description:
From 23 April until 24 May, Muslims around the world are fasting from dawn till dusk in the holy month of Ramadan, with the purpose of teaching discipline, sacrifice, and empathy for those who are less fortunate.

When Ramadan comes to an end, Muslims will wish each other Eid Mubarak (“Happy Holidays”), and this year we’re asking you to join the spirit of Ramadan, whether you are Muslim or not, and support FEED Mubarak!

Trussel Trust do an incredible job campaigning to stop UK hunger, supporting food banks nationwide for people locked in poverty.

You can donate directly online, or take donations to your local food bank. Food banks are currently short on donations for Halal food specifically, as well as canned, non-perishable goods and well-in-date, easily packageable food (with no manual separation needed).

Title: Winsford Diamonds 10 day marathon challenge

Description:
Anne is offering virtual photoshoots to a limited number of small business owners in exchange for a £25 donation to The Trussell Trust.  

All you need is an iPhone, good internet connection, good natural light and a good sense of fun!  You'll be in *your* home, and Anne will be in hers - a little planning, a date is set, and the magic begins!

These are perfect for lockdown - a distraction, a bit of fun, and you'll have images to use on social media for your business. Places are limited, so get in touch with Anne at studio@annethomasphotography.co.uk for bookings.

More about The Trussell Trust

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure. We're working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: Anne's Virtual Photoshoot Opportunity

Description:
Carla, Cindy, Dan and Julie are Talent Development Managers on the HR Fast Stream within the UK Civil Service. We have each committed to carry out 26-miles of activity in 7-days to raise funds for The Trussell Fund, the organisation that does great work providing food to those in need via food banks.

Carla - with her husband and son will be cycling 26-miles over a week

Cindy - will be walking 26-miles over the week

Dan - will be running 26-miles over a week

Julie - will be running 26-miles over the week

Thank you to everyone that supports the Trussell Trust in donating to this page. Their need is greater than ever right now.

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: The HRFS Team's 2.6 Challenge

Description:
Over the coming weeks, we’d like for people to get involved and to do something creative. It can be art, knitting, a funny video, a poem about life in quarantine - just about anything creative! 

As you've submitted your 'work',  please upload to the charity auction folder on the planning Sharepoint site. 

People can then check out the collection and go to Just giving, donate money and write which item they are 'bidding' (donating) for. 

Hopefully we end up with a rich collection of inspiring and fun creations, it will also be interesting to see the diversity of talent across the department :). There is also no such thing as no talent. To quote Sophie Parker, 'Always be proud of your work!'

All the donations will go to Trussell Trust. The charity has over 1,200 food bank centres in the UK network which they use to provide emergency support to those in need of food during COVID-19 and beyond.
Title: Mindshare - Embrace your inner artist!

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

The S6  foodbank is a great Organisation helping people who need a support. It shouldn’t be needed in an economy like ours but sadly it is. So your support is greatly appreciated.
Title: Christmas 2018

Description:
I've been growing my hair for a while now, in part due to laziness, in part to see what it looks like. Today I got sent home from work as my girlfriend has a cough, and this is where I must stay for the next two weeks. I fortunately have enough food in my house for this time, but perspective is important. Thousands are currently at risk as they don't have this privilege. It is for this reason that, from my isolation, I want to help and I encourage you to too. 

The longer one's hair becomes, the more daunting the idea is to cut it. At present my messy mop has taken numerous months of cultivation. I've defended it's appearance to my girlfriend, my colleagues and my family. Now it will go. The more I raise the shorter it will be cut. Now is the chance to see my whole head gleaming like a fortune teller's crystal ball.
Title: A Sped Up Recession

Description:
This year we celebrating Purim differently.

We remind ourselves that we are part of a local and global community, and many of us have roots from across the UK and the rest of the world.  By not hiding ourselves but reaching out to others, we will learn from Queen Esther to stand up, acknowledge whom we are, and be an active part of our wider community.

Thanks for taking the time to visit the Crouch End Chavurah Purim 2020 JustGiving page to support the people in the UK without job / financial security in these challenging times, who may be dependent on food banks in the UK.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity.
Title: Purim Fundraiser - Trussell Trust

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

Have you seen the movie "i, Daniel Blake", if not please go, it highlights the plight of people in this country living in poverty, its quite shocking and we wanted to help if we could. So Lent comes along and well, here we are trying to make a difference to ordinary people, please help if you can. Thank you Helen & Helen
Title: Helen Thomas & Helen Whitaker are eating healthily on 1 pound a day (weekdays in Lent)

Description:
Hello Everyone!

TC Lee13 & The Tank Club Present - The Trussell Trust Weekend Stream Fundraiser
Twitch: https://www.twitch.tv/TC_Lee13

With the global crisis currently ongoing due to COVID-19 I have decided this weekend I will do a charity stream to raise money for The Trussell Trust.
All money raised will go towards supporting their Food Bank Network which last year provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children.

This weekend will be the start of the Jesters Festival!
Twitch Drops will be on from Friday at 14:00 GMT until Monday at 14:00 GMT. Details on stream with the !drops command.
Music Requests will be on all night on Friday and Sunday

Friday - Stream Starting at 19:00 GMT - Trials Night & Super Sour Sweet Challenge! A collection of the most sour sweets available consumed with every donation or trial wipe!

Saturday - Stream starting at 15:00 GMT - Guinness World Record attempt!!! Ever took part in a Trials Marathon? Well this will be something for the record books.

Sunday - Stream Starting at 18:00 GMT - Team Trials & Bean Boozled - Every donation or trial wipe = Bean Boozled time!

Giveaways every £100 raised for The Trussell Trust
Free Twitch Sub for every donation of £50+
£100 Giveaway - 750 Crowns
£200 Giveaway - Copy of ESO
£300 Giveaway - 1500 Crowns
£400 Giveaway - Bristlegut Piglet & ESO+
£500 Giveaway - 3000 Crowns
£600+ Giveaway - The Tank Club Merch

I hope to see as many of you as possible over the weekend to help me support this important and vital cause at this difficult time.

Thank you all.

Title: Afreen's Raising money

Description:
I'm taking part in the Stay At Home Sleepout to raise funds for people who are homeless and in poverty. The money raised will go towards supporting local food banks that help the homeless and vulnerable gain access to vital supplies.

Now more than ever there are millions of people relying on food banks to help feed themselves and their family, if you are in a position to help I would love if you could donate to help support the cause! 

What I'm actually doing:

Come 8PM June 1st I will be taking up residence in my back garden until the following morning, sleeping out in a sleeping bag. I am hoping that it doesn't rain otherwise it will be a very soggy experience indeed, however, even if it did, I have the luxury of going back inside the following morning, having a hot meal and a bath whereas the people we are hoping to help do not, they have no home. 

Anyone that knows me knows I hate shadowy places and things that go bump in the night so sleeping outside without the comfort of a tent is so not my thing! I will be posting updates throughout the night and hopefully be able to raise some money to help those in need! 

Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page :)
Title: CEO Sleepout

Description:
Food banks across the UK are being forced to close as the Covid 19 pandemic leads to a decline in volunteers and a shortage in food donations. The Trussell Trust supports a nationwide network of food banks with emergency food and campaign for change to end the need for food banks in the UK.

My local food bank Leeds North West serves 9 distribution centres across Leeds with emergency food supplies.

To reach my goal of running a half marathon on 15th June, I will need to double my current running distance of 10k to reach 21k (13 miles). Please give generously!
Title: Sarah's half-marathon

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: Remy's tour of London Monuments over 4 days

Description:
The 17th of May was meant to have been my last scheduled performance with The King & I, at the New Wimbledon Theatre. Sadly, due to CoViD-19, this was not to be. I am singing "I Have Dreamed" from the production, because I had a really great time on tour and wanted to commemorate it by helping a good cause.

Since the lockdown began, the use of food banks in the UK has skyrocketed. Over the weekend, we found out that our local food bank, the Wimbledon Food Bank, is critically low on supplies to support those in need.

I hope you enjoy the song. If you are able to, please consider making a donation to The Trussell Trust, who run food banks across the UK including the Wimbledon Food Bank via this page which my mum has helped me set up. Every little helps. Thank you, and stay safe!
Title: Poppy-Mei singing for suppers

Description:
More than ever before, people are having to rely on food banks to feed their families throughout the COVID-19 pandemic. So I’ve decided to try and help out - raising funds for the Trussell Trust by running a marathon over a week. That’s only 6km a day, which sounds easy enough on day one but might not feel it by day seven!

I’ll be starting on Monday 18 May and running each day to finish on Sunday 24 May. I’ll be doing the challenge together in spirit - but not actually in person - with some of my friends from the Dorking Outdoor Fitness group.

The Trussell Trust supports a nationwide network of food banks, as well as campaigning to help those locked in poverty in the UK. It has seen a massive 81% increase in need for emergency food parcels since the end of March and an even greater rise in food parcels given to children.

It would be amazing if you could spare anything to help them continue their vital work and get food to those who need it most.

I’ll let you know how I get on!

Thank you,

Nicola

P.S. This is a close as I’ll get to running an actual marathon!!
Title: Marathon in a week for Trussell Trust

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. The COVID-19 pandemic has disproportionately affected foodbanks and now, more than ever, they need our support.

Please support the trainees of Simmons & Simmons LLP as we embark on our Simmons Trainee 1000 challenge!

Volunteers from the trainees are going to walk, run and cycle as far as they can in the week commencing 11 May 2020 to reach a total of 1000km !

Please sponsor us to support the Trussell Trust. Any amount, no matter how big or small, will be greatly appreciated and will make a difference to those who need it the most.
Title: Simmons Trainee 1000

Description:
Even before Covid, there has been a huge increase in the need for food banks. I aim to raise £1,000 for the Trussel Trust, which is a national food bank charity. 

I believe that the fallout from the Covid-19 pandemic in the UK will result in hundreds of thousands, if not millions of additional people unable to cope financially, though no fault of their own - mostly due to a massive increase in unemployment. So, food banks have already come under increasing pressure. When the furlough scheme ends this will almost certainly become even worse.

I am working from home and 'shielding' for an unknown number of weeks or months, and wanted to help the outside world cope with the current crisis somehow: hence my exercise bike 'cycling' challenge,

I normally use the exercise bike for 2-3 hours a week so, my Cycling target is a challenge. A few days ago, I had the idea, so I used Google Maps to see how far that would be: 1,530 kilometres - 950 miles.

Starting on Friday 8th May, VE Day, this should allow me to 'get to John O'Groats' by VJ Day: Saturday 15th August, if not before. Feel free to donate here for the Trussel Trust.

I originally thought this might take me about three months, but I have got noticeably faster as I progresssed, so that I now expect to reach 1,530 Km around the 10th of July.
Title: Andrew's exercise bike challenge

Description:
I’m climbing Kilimanjaro, well sort of! A lockdown version. 6000m which equates to 304 ascents of my stairs a day for 7 days from 7th to 14th May. (Timelapse videos posted each day).

COVID-19 is having a devasting impact on our most vulnerable adults and children. Food bank donations are down as well as volunteer support.

By sponsoring me you will help the Trussell Trust to help those in need. 

Please help if you can and donate or show support and join in with me. Let's do it together 💪🏼.

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Description:

Holly supports everyone but especially food banks .

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Title: Hollys Zumba thanks

Description:
On 1st May 2020, Smith Goodfellow celebrated 40 years in business. It's a huge milestone for us, especially given the current global pandemic and the impact it's having on small businesses like ours around the world.  Because community is one of the most important things to us as a business, and a team, we want to celebrate by giving back. Over the next 12 months, we will be undertaking 40 good deeds, big and small, to support our local community, other businesses and charities close to our hearts. 

We're kicking off by walking, running, cycling and dancing 400 miles in 40 days to raise money for The Trussell Trust. This is not your usual sponsored walk/cycle/run because several members of the team are self isolating - we're going to be getting creative and completing our miles in all sorts of ways, including exercise bikes, step machines! 

We've chosen to support The Trussell Trust for this because we want to support the vital service that they offer. More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year. Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure. The Trussell Trust are working closely with their network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how each food bank can be best supported in the coming months to make sure that they're able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Anything you can give to help this worthy cause will make a difference. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for being part of our 40 year journey and for helping us give back to communities across the UK. We hope you are staying safe and well.
Title: Smith Goodfellow's 400 for 40

Description:
St Richards Catholic College in Bexhill would normally support the Bexhill Foodbank during the year and with their Lenten Foodbank Walk.

 Sadly, this hasn't been possible this year with the restrictions we now face.  So .... during this 'lockdown' I have been using my 'hour a day' exercise slot to run, walk and cycle with my family. In honour of the marathon 2.6 challenge, I decided to try and reach 260 miles during 'lockdown' to raise money for the local Bexhill Food Bank. 

Any donation no matter how small will help support this valuable resource in our communities which provide much needed basics and support that most of us take for granted! With many people finding themselves in such difficult situations, especially during this crisis of Covid - 19 , you never know when any of us may need to use it.!
Title: 26 mile challenge

Description:
I was thinking of doing something quizzy for my friends and colleagues during lock down.  It did take longer than I expected and so I figured that if I could raise some money for such a worthwhile cause at the same time I would give it a go (let's face it, I'm never going to be running marathons for charities!)  This seemed such an obvious choice of charity to support...

Description:
I have always said I would volunteer at a food bank because I feel so sad that I live in a world where they have to exist. However I have also always given myself the excuse that ‘I don’t have time to help’ so in light of current events and the families that must be struggling so much in this situation, I have decided to try and raise a few pennies.

If you can spare a few coins please do.
Title: Mark's Head Shave

Description:

Title: Dan & George's Mount Kilimanjaro Climb.

Description:
The Trussel Trust support those most in need across the United Kingdom. No one in this country should go hungry and it is a sad state of affairs that reliance on food banks is growing daily. Over a six month period from April-September 2019, 823,145 three day emergency food parcels were given to people in crisis in the U.K over a third of these, (301,653) went to children. To put that in to perspective that's a 23% increase on the same period the following year.

Anything that you can give to help support the Trussel Trust and the national food bank will be greatly appreciated.

I had aimed to run three marathons and several shorter races during 2020, but most have obviously been cancelled or postponed because of Coronavirus. Instead I have changed the challenge to me running as many miles as I can during 2020. I will still undertake challenges to keep the motivation going. 

The biggest challenge was to run 100 miles in a week from the 25th-31st of May as part of a virtual running challenge which included a 55 mile lap of the Isle of Arran which I completed in roughly 9 hours 45 minutes on a very hot day! 

After a disappointing summer running wise due to injury (I couldn’t really run properly for 3-4 months) I am now back to roughly running 40 miles a week. So far this year I have completed 1733 miles in 250 hours of running with an elevation gain of 172,000ft.

I am aiming to run at least one more marathon before the end of the year..

 Make sure that those in need have food this Christmas time by supporting the national food bank.

Thanks for visiting my justgiving page.
Title: Running as many miles as I can in 2020!

Description:
We are very shaken by the current pandemic that is afflicting the world. This is an unprecedented challenge, and we don’t yet know how things will unfold.

Supermarket shelves are empty. People are filling up their own trollies and cupboards to try to deal with the panic of an unknown pandemic - and food banks up and down the country are running out of food. Last year, food banks in Trussell Trust's network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can end the need for food banks.

We expect no one should be left hungry or destitute.

We have put together a series of live streams that will be broadcasted on our platforms on Fridays and on Saturdays, as a sign of hope, unity and positivity for those who want to spend 1 hour in our company and enjoy the music we love, analyse and discuss some fundemantal topics for us and share knowledge, culture and innovation around the world. Furthermore, we will act in compliance with the rules as this will ensure the safety of both, those who make the recordings and those who listen to them, in order to promote temporary social distancing.

Join us on facebook.com/ComaSoundLTD/ at 7PM (UK Time) every Friday and Saturday during this lockdown that has been imposed upon us.

All the money raised here goes directly to the Trussell Trust, who will use it to support people in need and at risk of food insecurity and hunger throughout the UK.

If you can't afford to donate - sharing it on social media and enjoying some quality music is free! Thank you for your support.

--------------

Coma was born on the 3rd of December 2010 as a platform for new and talented artists to develop and emerge alongside well known artists who hardly performed in the U.K. before and whom brought a new emphasis to the U.K.'s underground electronic music scene. comahq.com

The Trussell Trust, in conjunction with local communities, develops and runs sustainable projects in the UK tackling poverty and exclusion. Through the UK Foodbank Network and Community Enterprises we work with marginalised people in real need, providing practical care and support. trusselltrust.org

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I'm going to be doing a 7 day water fast between 09/11/2016 - 16/11/2016. This involves not eating or drinking anything other than water for 7 days.

More than 13 million people live below the poverty line in the UK and this is as high as 10% of people in Scotland. The Trussell Trust helps to provide for these individuals and families through food banks.

The main reason for me doing this is to raise a lot of money for the charity and hopefully help a lot of people, but also to experience what it is like to go try and go about my normal life after not eating for a few days which is what some people have to do when providing for their families.

Title: Liams fast for food

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Poverty in this country is becoming a real issue. The use of food banks has increased by 97% in the  last year. It's heartbreaking to think that in the 21st century, there were families this Christmas that had no food and no presents for their children. Women have to rely on food banks for sanitary items, due to their vast expense. Issues with universal credit have left many families without any money over the Christmas period. The fallout from poverty is enormous; mental health issues, access to health services, travel, employment, access to healthy food, happy and well cared for children. 

Without foodbanks, many people in poverty would have NO access to food at all. They provide a safe space. Somewhere warm and dry. They can also offer support and advice to those in need, who may be isolated or unsure of their options. We have nurses in this country who have to use foodbanks, just to survive. I can't change the way this country is going (I wish I could), but if I can do something, even if it's only a small contribution, then I feel like I've helped in some way. Also, please donate food to local foodbanks whenever you can. You never know when you might have to rely on their services yourself. You can visit: 

https://www.trusselltrust.org/get-help/find-a-foodbank/?gclid=EAIaIQobChMI_43Akrex2AIVZLftCh0_TQCUEAAYASAAEgL6FvD_BwE and enter a postcode to find your local foodbanks. 

Donate by text by texting VAPE67 to 70070. For a £1 donation, text VAPE67 £1.  Minimum is £1 

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Jen's Dry January to raise money for Trussell Trust

Description:
Due to the Coronavirus outbreak enquires to the food banks have gone up threefold and donations have plummeted. Last year food banks provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Just imagine that this year around 4 million food parcels  may be needed, at the point where food bank reserves are at their lowest. We need to help people with their absolute basics to get through this crisis. 

So as a light hearted incentive in troubling times I am asking you to guess Georgie’s breed makeup. Just look at those ears...who do they belong to? Does she really have donkey in her DNA or is this a red herring? We will find out exactly what she is in April......

Some clues:

She loves to snuggle up in bed

She is as fast as the speed of light.....

Cat’s however chase her

She can be a bit naughty and stubborn 

She loves all humans

She gets over excited, especially with ball games

Bees and flies ( and presumably wasps) are worth chasing



The person/s guessing the nearest combination will have a special prize. (To be decided) To enter please donate anything on this page and please leave your name.
Title: Julia's Guess The Breed Results are In

Description:
Alhamdulillah we’ve reached the target of £5,800 (and the increased target of £8000!). I've left this donation link open, so that we can continue to increase the capacity of the Mosque and add extra facilities to improve the Masjid in sha Allah 

As a thank you for your generous donation, you will receive a Thank You e-mail from JustGiving containing a link which will allow you to download a Ramadan e-Cookbook, with 30 recipes from some well-known Restaurants & Food Bloggers.

If you do not receive the link to download the e-Book in your e-mail, please forward your confirmation link to hello@halalfooddiary.com, or DM us on Instagram at @halalfooddiary and we will send over the link ASAP in sha Allah.

——————————

Alhamdulillah after reaching our target of £20,000 with the Feed the Fasting and Orphan Sponsorship projects, we are now raising funds to build a mosque as a form of Sadaqah Jariyah!
(Zakaat can not be paid towards a mosque)

The Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) said: ''Whosoever helps build a house (Masjid) for the pleasure of Allah, whether it be small or large, Allah builds for him a house in Paradise.' [Tirmidhi]

Charity Partner: Muslim Hands
Location: Sindh, Pakistan
Accomodates: 70+ people
Use: Mosque will be used for 5 daily prayers, a location for meetings/religious events/other community purposes
Cost includes: £5,800 will include the concrete mosque, washrooms, ablution area, sanitary fitting, water connection, white washing walls and electrification work
Additional funds raised: will be put towards expanding the mosque and purchasing Qur'ans/fans/speakers

Zakaat can NOT be paid towards the building of a mosque, therefore if you wish to donate your Zakaat money, then the Orphan sponsorship project is still available for you to donate to:

https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/halalfooddiary2020-orphans

May Allah bless you for your generosity.

Description:

Great Ormond Street Hospital supports seriously ill children from all over the UK. Every day 619 children and young people arrive at GOSH to receive care and life saving treatments to ensure they can continue to lead healthy lives.

Since 2012, Premier Inn and Restaurants have been proud partners of Great Ormond Street Hospital Charity and we know our passionate teams have taken part in many brilliant fundraising events as well as volunteering at national events around the country and at the hospital.

During these uncertain times our teams continue to achieve incredible things, challenging themselves to conquer their Everest and take care of their wellbeing. We are looking to continue the fantastic fundraising achieved through our partnership by supporting our teams in their creative and dedicated ways of personal achievement.

We are #innthistogether and together, we can continue our incredible work.

Title: MUSIC THAT GIVES charity event

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

SANTA PUNCHES POVERTY;  donate 1.00

When somebody asks me....”are you excited about Christmas?”, my answer is ALWAYS a resounding YES!! It’s the season of goodwill, a time for friends and family, a happy time for all.....well almost all.

What if you don’t have any friends? What if you don’t have any money? What if you don’t have a home?

It is reported by local authorities that there are over 200,000 people registered as homeless here in the UK, more if you count those that “the system” misses; for more detailed information visit the following link:-

https://crisis.org.uk/media/236823/homelessness_monitor_england_2017.pdf

What will Christmas mean to this ridiculously high number of people?

The answer....the exact opposite to how you and I feel. Imagine how being cold and hungry throughout our winter months feels.......try it for a night, I guarantee you’ll not be doing it again.

Homelessness affects people of all ages, old, young, middle aged....a high percentage suffering with a Mental Health issue.

So if you’re willing, here’s what I suggest we do, either donate just 1.00 direct to the Trussell Trust to support their campaign “stopping UK hunger”.

A link to the Trussel Trusts website directory is below:-

https://www.trusselltrust.org/

OR.....

Imagine what a MASSIVE difference it would make to our country’s needy if every day throughout December we all put aside at least 1 tin or packet of food as a donation, and once a week delivered what we have collected to a local Food-Bank?

The Trussell Trust, a fantastic charity trying to “stop UK hunger”, have a searchable directory of Food-Banks listed on their website that rely almost entirely on the general public for food and drink donations. I guarantee that every single one of these Food-Banks will be inundated with requests for food and drink from Britain's Homeless over the coming festive season.

If you’re up for the challenge, register here, visit the Trussell Trusts website to locate your nearest Food-Bank, and let’s start giving.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/santa-punches-poverty-tickets-39698608607

One last thing to ask, let’s flood Social Media with the tag #santapunchespoverty and show our support for the UK‘s homeless society, showing the powers that be that homelessness is simply not acceptable in this day and age.

Thank you for reading, and let’s give generously!

Please feel free to post photographs of you and your family and friends "giving" on yours and my Twitter page.

Dave

@secbus

Title: HELEN's Dry January

Description:
With the world the way it is right now, there are some very vulnerable people at this horrible time. However, the amazing people at The Trussell Trust  are currently sending out food boxes to those who need it most. Because of the current situation, supermarket drop off donations have fallen, yet the demand for the boxes (roughly worth around £8-£13 each) are growing. 

So...

On Sunday 5th April, I will be streaming two live internet dance classes for young people and their families (I know you all want to join in!!!), to support this cause. There is no set fee for class entry, and can be completely free of charge if needs be. However, if you do have any spare change, even a £2 donation for the class would be amazing and would go towards helping those who are most vulnerable. 

Schedule will be as follows:

11am--11:45am - General ability (roughly 6-12 years old) - This class will be aimed as a fun, carefree and enjoyable 45 minutes of exercise for those who enjoy dancing!

Via this link >>> 
https://us04web.zoom.us/j/724021434

Meeting ID: 724 021 434

12pm-1pm - Intermediate/Advanced (roughly 12-18+ years old) - This class will be aimed for those who currently take part in dance lessons, and for the young ones who fancy something a bit more challenging!

Sam Freeman is inviting you to a scheduled Zoom meeting.

Via this link >>> 
https://us04web.zoom.us/j/389283838

Meeting ID: 389 283 838

The class will be via a Zoom video link (accessible through smartphones or the internet). 

IMPORTANT INFO:

On the day, follow the link to join in! Any questions, feel free to email me at movementbyswf@gmail.com

Hope to see as many of you, virtually, there as possible!

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us.  

The coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak has made it much more difficult for many people to financially or physically access food. This includes thousands on no or low incomes, including many older people, those with disabilities, rough sleepers and asylum seekers and migrants with No Recourse to Public Funds.

The emergency food aid sector, including food banks, are struggling to cope amidst a fall in donations, insufficient supplies from supermarkets and a lack of volunteers. The Trussell Trust and Independent Food Aid Network – charities which represent food banks across London and the UK – have recently reported some food banks have been forced to close or are considering closing due to a shortage of food and people to run them.

We have gathered student DJs from across the UK to perform during a livestream to raise funds for food banks in need across the country.

#ThisCanChange

Title: The Bedfordshire Kids

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year. Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, it is likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure. 

As part of our weekly food shop in St Albans, my wife and I always buy a couple of food items to put into the food bank. I have noticed that since the Coronavirus lockdown started, the amount of food donated has decreased massively, which is understandable given everybody's changing circumstances and concerns about their personal welfare. At the same time, demand for food banks is increasing, so I would like to do something to contribute to this worthy cause.

As I've been furloughed since April 1st, I have had time to do more cycling than I would otherwise. I had planned to ride in an organised event later in the year to raise money for a charity but with no guarantee of when this may be possible, I have decided to do the ride next week. So my plan is to ride 100 miles through the countryside of Buckinghamshire, Bedfordshire and Hertfordshire taking in towns and villages such as Ivinghoe, Woburn and Baldock. As I use the Strava app, I intend to publish the ride details once done. Because my route will be estimated as 100 miles, if I complete it and find I am short, I will endeavour to make up the extra miles before I step back indoors!

The ride date is scheduled for May 20th with the proviso that if the weather is particularly bad I would move it to the next possible date. At the moment the forecast is good so fingers crossed!

Thank you in advance for any donations you can make.

At the very least I should be able to egg him on... He’s quite competitive don’t you know.

See daily themed(!) updates by visiting Midsomer Norton Primary School and Nursery’s Facebook page.

Update 5th May. Thank you for everybody’s support to help me reach my original goal of £300. Still 26 days to go so I’ve increased the target to £500.

Please share!
Title: Alun's 100 stairs a day challenge

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.

As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Harvey Family's Foodbank Fundraiser

Description:
Inspired by other similar charity events I have decided to complete my staircase version of the three peaks challenge. Anyone who knows me will be familiar with my love of the mountains, obviously I can’t get out there at the moment, so I have decided to climb the equivalent combined  height of the highest peaks in Scotland, Wales and England (not Britain’s there highest peaks - they're all in Scotland). I’m trying to raise money for the Trussel Trust who provide much needed food banks across the country, sadly needed at the best of times but even more important at this time of crisis. Please help me.

I need to ascend 15,660 steps in total. That’s 1205 times up and down the stairs.

Scafell Pike 4500 steps, Snowdon 4610 steps, Ben Nevis 6550 steps.

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Title: Craig & Ashley cycling 26.2 miles .

Description:
Action Hands is a community campaign launched during COVID19 by London Nursery Schools (LNS) founder Sara Brennan, Amanda Frolich and Alison Wheeler to support the well being of young children and families through music and play. 

With this song "Time To Shine", The Action Hands team is raising funds for the Trussell Trust to provide food for families in need during COVID19. 

Last year, Trussell Trust food banks provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. The Trussell Trust aims to end the need for food banks. As a nation, The Trussell Trust believes no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Thank you for watching our video Time To Shine.  

https://youtu.be/LcEJ-2WptvM

It is a cause very close to our hearts and we hope you can show your support for this worthy cause.  The song will be available soon to purchase and download on all the regular digital platforms.  All profits from the downloads will also go to The Trussell Trust.  

Keep safe everyone!

With love

Action Hands   

(Sara/Amanda/Alison)
Title: Action Hands -  Time To Shine

Description:
We’re both suckers for junk food and have decided to get healthier for a great cause!

From 1st May until 1st December 2020 we are giving up chocolate, biscuits, sweets and crisps! We don’t do anything by halves! 

Last year, Trussell Trust food banks provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics and during the Covid 19 crisis, food banks are under even more pressure.

With your help, we can replenish some of the extra food that has been needed during this time as the Trussell Trust works towards ending the need for food banks all together. 

No one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Helen and Rosies Junk Food Detox!

Description:
We're going to be carrying out a 2.6 tri-challenge.

Bridget and William are a doing 26 minute tri-challenge - 8m40 running through a sprinkler, 8m40 biking round the garden and 8m40 running round the garden.

Alastair is doing 26 pull ups, 26 pushups and running 2.6 miles

I'm running 26 x round the garden, 26 x up the stairs and finishing with 26 pushups.

Rhona is baking 26 cookies, which we'll need at the end!

We're hoping to raise £26 each for the Trussell Trust:

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Title: The Mitchell's 2.6 Challenge

Description:
After a mixture of wanting to take part in the charitable challenges, and also wanting to do something to help those less fortunate in these lockdown days days... I decided to set a challenge to some friends. There are several great efforts going on to raise money for the NHS charities, so I thought i’d go with something that is local to many of my friends and colleagues - this is the area right next to Dell Glasgow (remember that place!?)

Challenge is simple (but not easy!) & for the golfers out there, but anyone can try it!

Just like several similar challenges, the golfer needs to get 20 balls, place a bucket, basin or plant pot etc. 10 feet away. Film yourself hitting all 20 and for everyone you get in the bucket - donate (a minimum) of £2.00 to the just giving page below.

https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/carlo-cocozza

The idea is to get a lot of people taking part, so please post your video and nominate another garden golfer!

If you are tagged in this, you are nominated 😉 good luck!

Eg get 1 out of 20, donate £2 (or whatever you choose).
Get none in, donate at least £2 anyway. Every ‘ball in the bucket’ could be a meal for someone.

———

Title: SALC Pub Quiz for Central Manchester Foodbank

Description:
In this period of Coronavirus lockdown there is increased pressure on the food banks for a variety of reasons:-

  • Unexpected job losses and increase in demand for supplies.
  • Regular donators being on lockdown.
  • Supermarket restrictions on purchasing multiple items.
  • Closure of many community buildings which act as drop off points for donations.

There is an amazing team of people working in the Bromley warehouse and in the centres, but they can only work with what has been donated.

Last year, food banks in their network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, they can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

I am hoping that I can help to raise funds to help them to keep supporting those that need them in the community.

I will buzz cut my hair to No. 6 all over if my full target is met. If I don't meet the target I should still like to keep your donations and would be happy to sport a suitable haircut commensurate with the amount raised - the more money, the more extreme. If I smash my target it could be a No 5 or shorter!!!

Please help.
Title: Miss Denton's 'Head Shave' Challenge

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I've been inspired by a friend in the armed police who is proudly sporting a mullet to raise some money for the NHS!

I'd like to raise money for the Bracknell Food Bank, run by Kerith Community Church in partnership with the Trussell Trust, to support those in need during these testing times!

Please give anything you can - if you want to join the trend send a picture of your isolation haircut!!

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: David's isolation cut - hair to impress!

Description: Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. I’m not running a marathon or doing anything heroic like that, I just want to try to raise a bit of money to support The Trussell Trust, the UK’s main food bank charity, because I believe coronavirus panic buying at supermarkets by people who can financially afford to panic buy is wiping supermarket shelves clean of even the absolute basic essentials that people less fortunate than many of us can barely afford anyway. If you yourself have a few quid to spare, please help. What’s £10? A packet of fags or a takeaway pizza. Please help stop the Coronavirus Poverty Gap.
Title: Jonathan's Stop The Coronavirus Poverty Gap

Description:
Cyril, aged 6, decided to shave his head for the 'Trussell Trust' which is a vital food bank for people who are struggling financially. So many more people are struggling in these hard times.

I thought I'd keep him company and shave my head...again! 

Last time I did this was 2015 when my oldest, Olive, was nearly 3 and Cyril was 18 months. My youngest, Maud, is now 2 and a half. I raised £5000 for Cancer Research, as a joint effort with a friend, and donated my hair to 'The Little Princess Trust' who make wigs for children that have lost their hair due to cancer treatments.

I hope to donate to The Little Princess Trust again when they are up and running again. Blonde hair this time!

I am not expecting to raise anything near £5000 this time due to the current financial worries a lot of people will be faced with.

If all this does is save me from the worst root regrowth then so be it! 

Some people said bald suited me last time- it didn't and certainly doesn't this time as I am fatter, paler and older!

We are asking for anyone who can spare anything at all to donate to this worthy cause please and/or 'Share' as much as you can on any social media! 

Thank you,

Cyril and Claire. xxx
Title: Cyril and Mummy's head shave

Description:
August 2021 update: I’ll be riding a 5-day bike tour around southern England, starting with a loop around the North Downs, then riding from Guildford to Salisbury, the New Forest, Portsmouth, round the Isle of Wight and back to Guildford. After such generous sponsorship last year, I’m not pushing for it this time but there remains great need for the Trussell Trust food banks, even more so now with supermarket shortages and Brexit price rises. So if you’ve made it here, please consider a kind donation while I ride with a strapped-up hamstring!

______________________________________________________

To mark turning 50, I’ve been planning to cycle the story of my life, from where I was born, Guisborough in the North Riding of Yorkshire, via all the places in this country I’ve lived in – taking in Kirby, Oxford, Reading, Guildford, Reigate and London – to end in Cambridge.

It was just going to be a personal challenge to mark a significant milestone. However, having spent my 50th birthday in the pandemic lockdown, I wanted to turn the bike tour into a chance to raise money for the Trussell Trust, whose food banks so many people rely on and which sadly is in even greater demand now as the severe economic hardship for many during this crisis intensifies.

I will be setting off on Sunday 19th July. I’ll provide updates throughout the bike tour on my dedicated Twitter account: https://twitter.com/phil50biketour

Thank you for anything you are able to give to help the Trussell Trust help those who most need it.

Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trust network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, the Trussell Trust can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Phil 50 bike tour (the story of my life)

Description:
Food banks were important before, but they'll be even more essential during this Corona nightmare. 

So I'm letting 3 year old cassie try to shave my head. And I'll keep whatever that ends up with for at least 1 day, before I let my wife shave me number 1 bald. 

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Description: I will be taking part in Celtic FC Foundation's Zip Slide in Paradise event on Monday, April 13. Title: Zip Slide in Paradise 2020

Description:
In these unprecedented times, food banks will be more important than ever. Children that would have relied on free school meals may not receive them, thousands will lose jobs, and food poverty will undoubtedly rise. I've had my beloved beard for over five years and I've forgotten what my own face looks like. If I raise £200, I'll shave it off (and my girlfriend has agreed she can't leave me).

Trussell Trust's story:

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Title: Sion's Shaving the Beard for Trussell Trust

Description:
In this time of unprecedented crisis, many have lost their livelihoods and income meaning food security has become an even greater concern within our community and food banks are vital. 

In an effort to fundraise for The Trussell Trust food bank network I will be shaving my head and donating my hair to the Little Princess Trust who provide free, real hair wigs to children with hair loss and fund crucial research into childhood cancers. 

Unfortunately, given the current situation, the Little Princess Trust are understandably unable to receive hair donations and I won’t be able to shave my head until they can. 

However, considering the recent enforcements made to prevent virus spread, food aid is needed urgently and any donations, no matter the size, will be greatly appreciated by myself, The Trussell Trust and any person relying on food banks to stay safe and fed in this trying time. Even £2 can make a difference x

The Trussell Trust story:

 Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Shaving my head for The Trussell Trust

Description:
I am going to ride the distance of Lands End to John O'Groats (officially 876 miles, 1407kms) on an indoor bike starting on Saturday 11th April and will look to finish within the a week. I am raising money for the Trussell Trust who look after the UK food banks and at the moment families are in dire need of support. I hope you can donate as much as possible. 

You can join me on my ride on Zwift by following me. Just search for John McAvoy.

You can also donate via your mobile phone as follows:

Text JONNYMAC to 70450 to donate £5 - Texts cost £5 plus one standard rate message.

Or alternatively text:

“To donate £2 text JONNYMAC2 to 70450”

“To donate £10 text JONNYMAC10 to 70450”

“To donate £20 text JONNYMAC20 to 70450”
Title: John 's Zwifting from Lands End to John O'Groats

Description:
Myself and Kyle Freemantle across the Isle of Wight. Starting at Bembridge in the late afternoon and hiking overnight until we reach the needles in Alum bay. Not only will we be doing it overnight but we will have consumed no food for at least 24 hours. Our final meal would be the day before and we won't eat until we have completed the trial. We would obviously be carrying supplies in case of emergency but we will do our best to make it the whole way before consuming anything other than water.

Title: Overnight 25 mile hike with no food for 24 hours

Description:
The Metro Bank team in Sheffield have decided we would like to take on a new challenge. The plan is to complete the equivalent distance between the Metro Bank Store in Sheffield, to the most northern boundary in Yorkshire (The River Tees). The distance is 114 miles and we plan to cover this distance in a single day on June 5th 2020. Weather that be through walking, cycling or running. We will be setting off from our home locations, separately completing a route and plan to reach some of South Yorkshire’s landmarks and town’s along the way. 

We’d like to support Yorkshire’s Brain Tumour Charity because Brain Tumours can affect anyone, at any time. They are the single biggest killer of the under 40's in the UK. Every week approx 15 people are diagnosed with a brain tumour in Yorkshire. Research has been underfunded for brain tumours, with current treatments nearly 40 years old. The charity aim’s to fund world-class research here in Yorkshire to find treatments and a cure. Whilst they do that, they will also provide support to people living with and affected by brain tumours, emotionally, practically and financially for as long as they need them.

Title: Donations for Southampton spiritualist church to help with its running costs whilst closed and to prepare food for its re-opening of the food bank

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: Harry and George's Flat out to France page

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.

As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Caroline and George's Epic Morecambe Cycle

Description:
On the 20th May 2020 join the Great British Fast for Food Banks
Donate the price of a meal (or more) to the Trussell Trust today!  


The national press have reported that, due to COVID-19, the number of people forced into hardship has increased.  Use of Food Banks has in some cases more than doubled. 
At the same time, due to the lockdown, donations have slowed.

We have to come together as a country and make sure support is there to protect people from food poverty during this emergency!

It also happens to be the month of Ramadan, when people of the Muslim faith refrain from eating and drinking from dawn to dusk.  Given the nature of the crisis, it seemed a fitting theme for this fundraising effort.

Please donate the price of a meal (or more) to the Trussell Trust today, and if you can, on Wednesday the 20th May 2020, people of all faiths and those of no faith, try and fast in support of those in the UK and around the world who are having to go without.


Once you have donated, tag in at least 5 of your friends and get them to join you in making this a huge national effort.


What does a fast entail?  Well, traditionally, going without food or drink from sunrise to sunset (Google can tell you the times).  If that seems a bit much, simply sacrifice whatever you are comfortable with, even if that's just your second Double Decker from the tuck shop at elevenses.

Of course, you don't have to fast if you don't want to, or if you have a medical condition, are taking medication, are pregnant, or really just find it too daunting an ordeal, please do not fast, but still please make whatever donation you feel comfortable making.

However much we raise for Food Banks is better than nothing!

Let's try to get these hashtags trending on social media with stories about what you are giving up, how your fast was, ideas, thoughts, videos and good wishes - and let's just see what happens.
#GreatBritishFast
#fast4foodbanks 

If this is successful as a campaign, perhaps we can run it again, maybe even one day a month, for as long as the Trussell Trust is needed in the UK to prevent people from falling into such hardship.


With Grace, who knows what we might achieve together.

The below is a message from the Trussell Trust so you can see the incredible work they do and the challenges they are facing.
.......
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.  Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank.
As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that they're able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Title: LW19 Anu's Keep Coffee and Covid Away

Description:
Myself and my team are committing to try something new and give something back to support those less fortunate than ourselves in this incredibly difficult time

Over the week we will be hosting virtual quizzes, learning new skills such as Spanish and yoga, having team bonding sessions and even doing individual challenges such as totally changing our hair colour (Not everyone)

We will also be walking the distance between everyone's home within the team, this is a total of 1054 miles, WE WILL WALK 1000 MILES

We would love to raise £1 for every mile walked

We appreciate anything that you can give and want to ensure we celebrate mental health awareness week by doing our bit to step back and ensure we are all looking after our own minds whilst also supporting others

Description:
Hi

My name is Finn, I am 8 years old and I have been inspired by Captain Tom.

I have decided to do 100 laps around my Crescent and I am hoping to do it over 4 days. I will finish on Monday 11th May. Each lap is 320m. When I finish I will have run 32000m or 32km.

 I am doing it for Nottingham food banks (the Trussell Trust).

Thank you for visiting my page and thank you for sponsoring me.

 Finn x

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: Finn's 100 Lap Challenge

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

Everyone hates burpees. Fact. What began as a challenge between friends we hope can turn into something good that can raise funds for the Lewisham food bank who are doing amazing things to look after the most vulnerable in our local community.

So, we have set ourselves the challenge of doing 1,000 burpees (each) in a day. It won’t be easy but hopefully knowing we are making a difference to those who need it most during these tough times will get us through!

The Lewisham food bank is part of a network of over 400 food banks, working to tackle food poverty and hunger in our local community, as well as across the UK. They provide food to those in need - something of particular importance as we fight the current Coronavirus. 

We hope our efforts will help raise funds for the food bank and awareness of all the good they are doing within our local community. Any donations would be very much appreciated!
Title: Steve and James do the 1,000 burpee challenge!

I'm going to be taking on the Everesting challenge on Zwift. It's simple - climb 8,848m or the equivalent of Everest in one ride. You are only allowed to use one climb, which you have to ride up and down repeatedly to make the height gain.

 Alpe du Zwift is 516m at its peak. I'm expecting to have to ride the segment 16 or 17 times, equating to about 200km in the saddle. Zwift allows you to freewheel downhill, so loo breaks can be taken while "descending". Other than that, it's going to be hard work and the threat of a pretty numb bum.
Title: Dan is Everesting Alpe Du Zwift!

Description:
Starting on Saturday 25th April, I’ll be running a marathon over 10 days averaging 2.62miles a day. To add a bit of humour, I will be RUNNING IN MY WEDDING DRESS! 😂 I’ll be doing this event to raise money for The Trussell Trust, who are working tirelessly to end hunger and poverty in UK. As a result of COVID they need our help more than ever right now. There are over 14 million people in the UK living in poverty, and 4.5 million are children.

We all need a bit of cheering up right now, and I thought the added comedy of running in my wedding dress would help put a smile on people's faces as I run past their homes. (I’ll obviously be strictly sticking to social distancing rules.)

Any donation to help this much needed cause would be hugely appreciated.

Title: Fundraising 2020

Description:
While we're all stuck at home, I wanted to do something to put a smile on your face, and raise some money for the Trussell Trust. The national charity's network of food banks are expecting to see an increase in need over the coming weeks as the coronavirus pandemic unfolds.

To help, and hopefully(!) brighten up your day, I am dedicating my mornings to video call as many of you who donate as possible. All you need to do is donate to the Trussell Trust on this page, ensure your phone number is included in your donation, and tick that you are happy to receive further communications so that I am allowed to call you!

By donating, not only will you be in for the chance of a receiving a video call from me, but you will also help people struggling as a result of the coronavirus pandemic. 

Food banks were already seeing an increased need before this outbreak but it's likely that more people than ever will be unable to afford their own food over the coming weeks, especially people who have unstable jobs or who aren't eligible for sick pay, and will need to turn to a food bank for support. 

Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trust’s network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over half a million of these of these going to children. 

Your donations will help the Trussell Trust support food banks in their network and ensure people in crisis can access emergency food during this challenging time. This money could help fund vans to help food banks deliver food to people's homes, buy food (if necessary and available!), recruit additional staff to meet the demand, but also, vitally, campaign for change so that everyone can afford their own food. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and I look forward to chatting to a few of you over the coming days.

NOW FOR THE LEGAL PART: 

All funds raised will go directly to the Trussell Trust. You can find out more about the organisation on their website www.trusselltrust.org. 

I will try to call as many of you as possible but it might not be possible to speak to everyone who donates. 

Please note that I can only contact you if you provide a phone number and ‘opt in’ to share their details with the Trussell Trust. 

The Trussell Trust is committed to protecting your privacy and will process any personal data in accordance with the General Data Protection Act 2018. Your details will be kept safe and secure, only used by the Trussell Trust or those who work for us and will not be shared, sold or rented to third parties for marketing purposes. In this instance, your details (first name, phone number and amount donated), will be shared with Michael McIntyre for the purposes of this fundraising event only.

We may use information you provide for analysis, research or screening purposes in order to help us understand our supporters so that we can save resources and deliver the best possible service.
Title: Michael McIntyre is supporting the Trussell Trust

Title: My 2.6 Challenge

Description:
Please join me on the Boxing Day 2019 from Midday for my charity stream to help raise as much money as we can for such an amazing cause.

You can find me at www.twitch.tv/nelinde

If you can't make a donation fear not! You can help by spreading the word and sharing this JustGiving page on social media and with friends and family.


No one should go hungry, especially at Xmas! 

Yet thousands of families are going without food due to poverty, parents going without so their children don't have empty bellies.

This is 2019! This shouldn't even be a thing... Sadly so many people in the UK are in this dire situation. It could be a neighbour or even a family member!

UK Food Banks are vastly overstretched and are in need of food donations more than ever before to meet the highest demands ever to be recorded since the Trussell Trust started in 1999!


But you can help spread a little Xmas cheer <3 


Please spare what you can afford, as little as £2 can afford a single meal!

You can also help by donating any spare "long shelf life" foods such as tinned vegetables etc to your local Food Bank or supermarket Food Bank collection box <3

Having personally relied on my local Food Bank in previous times of hardship I have first hand experience of the effect and contribution Food Banks have on so many people facing financial hardship and not being able to afford food for their families or themselves. They provide a light in times of darkness, often providing much more than just food. 

They offer an ear to listen, a personal connection where there is nothing but loneliness. Many Food Banks even provide clothing that they've had donated. My local Food Bank even run a free playgroup where parents can go to meet other parents and make friendships.

I can't stress how much a small donation can help <3

Title: Conqueror route 66 challenge page

Description:
On the 25th April this year I was supposed to travel over to the Highlands and run the Highland fling 54mile ultra marathon with a few mates.  Covid-19 has put a stop to that and confined us all to our homes.  I’ve found that hard but it strikes me that many people have it far worse!  Food banks are sadly going to be vital for many in the coming weeks and months so I have decided to still do the 54 miles, in my garden (1080 laps) to raise money for my local food bank charity.  If you are able to donate, I’d be really grateful.  Below you’ll find some info about my chosen charity.

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us especially at these unprecedented times.  With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Dan's Rock Hill Garden Ultra page

Description:
I set this page up for last year's marathon but it was then cancelled and this year's one moved to October. 

Before Christmas 2020 I read a lot about food banks in the UK and found it quite shocking. Not a lot has changed now and so I want to try to raise some more money. There are more people using them than ever in many parts of the country, and the Trussell Trust support a nationwide network of over 1200 food banks. They provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty, and campaign for change to end the need for food banks in the UK.

Between April 2019 and March 2020, food banks in the Trussell Trust network provided a record 1.9 million food supplies to people in crisis, an 18% increase on the previous year and during the coronavirus pandemic food banks have seen need rise even further.

I know I have run the marathon before, and I know I have asked for donations before. But this seems like a really worthy cause and an issue that worries me a lot so I hope people will find a few spare quid to donate. I will definitely top up the final total myself too as I feel in a very fortunate to be running the London Marathon and want to complete the race knowing it has also done some good. 

If you are a UK taxpayers and want to sponsor me please tick the Gift Aid box. This enables them to claim an extra 25p per £1 you donate at no extra cost to you. A £10 donation will be transformed into £12.50 and makes a huge difference so please do so. 

Many thanks 

Jeffers

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Planning lessons and marking are no longer on my to do list in the evenings, so I have been able to help a local hub to sew scrubs and have recently started making a few face masks during my spare time. I thought this is a great opportunity to raise money for a charity that runs by the people who are very close to my heart. The LifeHouse is a resource, support centre and kitchen that serves hot food in Albert Road, Southsea. They aim to target immediate needs and issues surrounding homelessness and addiction for those in need in Southsea. This place relies heavily on a team of dedicated volunteers (who are amazing!!) and local donations with food, clothing etc. Since their recent site expansion and refurbishment, they are hoping to be able to upgrade their kitchen equipment, furniture, and more importantly to be able to accommodate more people who are in needs. 

There is no set price of each face mask, but we ask for minimum donation of £7 for each which include postage. Each mask contains a small strip of wire so it can sit nicely on your nose. With a pocket on the reverse side where you can insert additional materials. Pattern choices are limited so message me for stock availability. Once you have made your donation, message me with your pattern choice and address and I aim to dispatch within 5 working days (I can only make these in the evenings!)
Title: Vivys homemade face masks

CharityAddress: High View, Dale Hill, Ticehurst, Wadhurst, TN5 7DG
Description:
“IF ANYONE SAVED A LIFE IT WOULD BE AS IF HE SAVED THE LIFE OF THE WHOLE HUMANITY.” QURAN 5:32

The Messenger of Allah (saw) was asked, “Which charity is best?” He replied, “[Providing] water”’. [Abu Dawud]

I have nothing to say except we need to save our brothers and sisters, we have forgotten them for SO LONG that it has led to this... their extinction. 

My heart aches, we will be asked regarding our neglect. May this charity come to our aid.

I am going to try and raise as much as we can, no cap. Please share far and wide. 

Jzk.
Title: United for Yemen

Description:
Olivia and George have decided they want to help fund Whipsnade Zoo in order to provide the animals with food. 
They have chosen to attempt a 16 km (10 mile) bike ride. This will be the greatest distance they have ever attempted on a bike. It will be a challenge for the both of them, but they are positive that they will be able to push on when it comes to helping out the vulnerable animals at the zoo.

They have decided that they will not only be attempting this bike ride, but the will also be donating all of their pocket money to help the cause. 

George (Age 5): "We don't want the lovely animals to die. We all need food including animals."

Olivia (Age 9): "It is important to me that the animals get the food they need as we don't want to lose them. They are amazing creatures who don't deserve to starve. Please can anyone spare any change so these animals don't go hungry?" 


We are fundraising to keep ZSL London & Whipsnade Zoos running throughout the duration of the COVID-19 crisis. ZSL London & Whipsnade Zoos need to get their more than 22,000 amazing animals from the majestic lions to the smallest, most colourful frogs fed and cared for throughout the crisis. The Zookeepers and vets are working night and day to care for them, but we need to help. As a charity, ZSL rely on funds from supporters and visitors. Animal lovers keep them going!The animal residents continue to squawk, prowl, leap, swim and hop thanks to the dedication of the wonderful team of keepers, vets, nurses and nutritionists. The most important way you can help at this time is to donate. Every gift really does make a difference to the animals and the dedicated staff caring for them.By coming together at this difficult time, we will continue to inspire and share a love of animals, and work together towards a future where wildlife can thrive.
Title: Olivia and George's 10 mile bike ride in aid of Whipsnade Zoo
